segments.text: The water is just pouring over the edge of the sink, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing in it, drying dishes like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far to reach those cookies, and that stool looks ready to collapse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting, like this is a normal day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everything looks outside, while inside, it’s a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman’s apron is going to be soaked soon, and she still won’t notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is almost empty, and the kids are going to get caught any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the floor is going to be a mess by the time someone finally pays attention.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The light from the window makes the whole scene look so peaceful, but it’s anything but.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR
